page.title: 06Durlston Castle
page.content: Among the amenities present in our study area, Durlston Head Castle is one of the focal points for tourists. It lies to the south of Durlston Country Park, with extensive south and west facing views over the English Channel. Never a real castle, more a Victorian folly, the buildings are now used as a private residence and a restaurant, bar, cafe and gift shop; with toilet facilities being available. Turrets like a real castle tower over the south wall, where two stone plaques show the different tide levels around the British Isles, and the time differences of selected places in the world.
